Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Two Plates for Household Use
Description: Two plates, for household use, were found at the location of the Alexandria Library during excavations. They were found among a huge number of plates and bowls. It is noticeable that they are devoid of any decoration, as were most articles that were used for food. They are shaped by casting and vary only in being different colors. They are made of black, red or beige clay.
